intro: Carex gracilis subsp. broteroana, commonly known as the slender sedges, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known for their narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Its botanical features include slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
